title: A Traitor's Worth
opening: After taking back the palace, the League rode across Akaneia, freeing the greater part of the kingdom as they went- all except the west. A landed knight there named Horace, who had betrayed Akaneia, to join Doluna, continued to stubbornly hold out against Marth’s forces. Nyna could not fathom why such a fiercely loyal knight would turn to treachery, but with her other knights calling for Horace’s blood, she had no choice but to give in and ask Marth to bring the traitor to justice.

intro.speaker: Dejanira
intro.line: Have you heard, Horace? I am told the rebels just recaptured the palace. That accursed Akaneian wench! Never mind Camus’s pleas. We should have put her to the sword with the rest of them…

intro.speaker: Dejanira
intro.line: Hm, something bothering you, now? Don’t tell me you are toying with the idea of rejoining your motherland? Because if you do, I think you know exactly what will befall your people.

intro.speaker: Horace
intro.line: Yes, you’ve made it quite clear! I am an Akaneian knight no longer. I knew this day would come when I gave me lance to Doluna. I will not flinch.

intro.speaker: Dejanira
intro.line: Good. Then gather your soldiers and kill these rebels before they cause any more trouble.

battle.speaker: Enemy Soldier
battle.line: Lord Horace, our soldiers are in position.

battle.speaker: Enemy Soldier
battle.line: Shall we advance on the enemy?

battle.speaker: Horace
battle.line: ...No. That won’t be necessary. We’ll lure them in close, then strike. No one attacks unless the enemy makes a move first. Is that clear?

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Lord Horace! I am Marth of Altea. I ask that you lay down your arms....

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: She is- and she’s quite worried about you, sir.

battle-talk.speaker: Horace
battle-talk.line: So Her Highness is alive... The soldiers who died protecting her can rest in peace. ...Now then, Prince Marth. Draw your sword.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Lord Horace, who rules this land, used to be a knight of Akaneia. After the palace fell, though, he bent his knee to the Dolunian emperor and has been servin’ him ever since. For that, folks call him a traitor and say he tarnished his knightly brethren’s reputation. Well, that’s a load of hogwash. He broke his knightly oaths to protect us! Not ’cause he’s some traitor. Please, sire, you have to help clear his name. Here…Lord Horace’s father, bless him, gave me this weapon as a gift long ago. I know he’d be glad to see it used to restore his son’s honor.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Are you with the League? Please, sir, I’m beggin’ ya...You have to help Lord Horace. He’s always looked out for us small folk, before and after he inherited the land. He’s a pillar of strength, he is. We’d be dead if he hadn’t made the tough choices he did. The least we can do is rescue him from his plight now. Here, I’ve got this magic tome one of our villagers found after the last battle on our soil. You take it, and find some way to save him. Promise!

boss.speaker: Dejanira
boss.line: Vexatious rebels! I’ll skewer you like rabbits!

end.speaker: Horace
end.line: What!? Dejanira’s been killed?! Then... it’s over. Soldiers! Lay down your weapons! No more Akaneian blood shall be shed! ...Mine shall be the last.

end.speaker: Horace
end.line: Bravo, Prince Marth. I yield. Spare the lives of my soldiers and treat my people kindly, and you may do with me as you see fit.

end.speaker: Villager
end.line: No! Wait, please! Lord Horace is a good man! Doluna threatened him, said they’d raze the land corner to corner if he didn’t comply. So you see-

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: Horace. I heard what you said. And you have it quite right. Your crimes deserve death, or worse.

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: But I shall give you no knight’s death. I shall give you a traitor’s life. You say you will not dress up your sins. I say you will not run from them either.

end.speaker: Horace
end.line: Your Highness...! Are you saying you wish me to live?

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: You did all in your power to protect these people. That was honorable, Horace. But if you die today, no one will remember you for anything but your one act of betrayal. Your soldiers will have to bear that shame in your stead. Do you call that justice?

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: Starting today, you shall prove to the world there was value in your actions. Show us a traitor’s worth. Show us what the soldiers who fought and died for you saw to be true.

end.speaker: Horace
end.line: I... I do not know what to say.

end.speaker: Horace
end.line: Heh... Very well, Your Highness. As you command...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Nyna, we have put down the western insurgence.

end.speaker: Nyna
end.line: Poor Horace. Marth, in his heart, I do not think he truly wished to betray Akaneia.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Nor I. Doluna must have threatened to do harm to his people.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: So Horace capitulated, to keep them safe... He acted to save lives, yet the world will brand him a traitor. That one word will come to define him... and none will ever know the traitor’s worth.
